an5.203:4.1: “Mendicants, a fine royal thoroughbred with five factors is worthy of a king, fit to serve a king, and is considered a factor of kingship.
an5.203:5.2: Integrity, speed, gentleness, patience, and sweetness.
an5.203:5.3: A fine royal thoroughbred with these four factors is worthy of a king. …
an5.203:5.4: In the same way, a mendicant with five qualities is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a teacher’s offering, worthy of veneration with folded palms, and is a supreme field of merit for the world.
an5.203:6.2: Integrity, speed, gentleness, patience, and sweetness.
an5.203:6.3: A mendicant with these five qualities is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a teacher’s offering, worthy of veneration with folded palms, and is a supreme field of merit for the world.”
